de.esoco.lib.event

Class EventDispatcher<E extends Event<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.event.EventDispatcher<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.lib.property.Immutability, java.io.Serializable

    public class EventDispatcher<E extends Event<?>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements de.esoco.lib.property.Immutability, java.io.Serializable
    An event handler implementation that dispatches events to a set of event handlers.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(EventHandler<? extends E> rHandler)
        Adds a new event handler to this instance. If the given handler is already part of this instance the call will be ignored. The generic argument is weakened to '? extends E' to allow the usage of handlers that use generic events but all event handlers in a dispatcher must always be based on the same (generic) event class or else a class cast exception will occur.
        Parameters:
        rHandler - The event handler to add

      • dispatch

        public void dispatch(E rEvent)
        See Also:
        EventHandler.handleEvent(Event)

      • getEventHandlerCount

        public int getEventHandlerCount()
        Returns the number of event handlers that are registered in this instance.
        Returns:
        The event handler count

      • remove

        public void remove(EventHandler<? extends E> rHandler)
        Removes an event handler from this instance.
        Parameters:
        rHandler - The event handler to add

      • setImmutable

        public void setImmutable()
        Description copied from interface: de.esoco.lib.property.Immutability
        Sets this object to be immutable. Afterwards, the object must not allow further modification of it's internal state.
        Specified by:
        setImmutable in interface de.esoco.lib.property.Immutability
        See Also:
        Immutability.setImmutable()
